results.title: Garden = Jardin
results.creator_credit: Christopher Nutter, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film animation experiment in metaphoric imagery. This is a surrealistic garden where the earth seethes with strange, unusual shapes and activity, accelerated in movement, compressed in time. Insect-like creatures dart under and over the sand with elusive swiftness; Picasso-like faces stare momentarily upward, mutate, and disappear; wilted blossoms become suddenly animated. What happens on the screen is punctuated and accompanied by synthetic sound effects. Music by Bruce Mackay.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Nutter, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is the boy-meets-girl game, but played without rules and at a time when the boy must prove himself in the chase. It is about the much-discussed sexual behavior of teenagers and shows that often the game starts with a challenge to his masculine ego from the boy’s peer group. Few adults are seen or heard from, nor does the film take sides in this game. A dramatisation.

results.title: The Hen = La Gallina
results.brief_description: Shows the habits and behaviour of a flock of hens and roosters, and close-ups of their physical features. They are seen feeding, and their behaviour within a group is shown, including calling to each other and fighting. In Italian - no subtitles.

results.title: The Future of alternative technology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Made Futures, Design and Technology”.
Defines “alternative” energy and technology and discusses the viability of this technology in technical and economic terms. Raises questions of whether alternative technology can be a major contributor in the production and consumption of energy.

results.title: A Future for the past
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Considers action to prevent the erosion of character in Britain’s historic towns and villages. Old photographs, live action and superimposed animation explain why and how towns change and what has been done and might be done in the future in areas worthy of conservation.

results.title: Bricks and mortar
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Explains how and why sources are allocated for adult education in South Australia.

results.title: Fungus plants
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Emphasis is given to the various mushrooms whose growth and reproduction are illustrated by time-lapse photography and animation. Moulds and other fungi are also presented by these same techniques. Their economic importance is indicated.

results.title: Field events
results.creator_credit: Jan Ladlo and Associated Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and techniques. The field events such as long jump; standing broad jump; high jump; discus; shot put; and javelin are explained.

results.title: Track events
results.creator_credit: George H. Fox, Jan Sadlo and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and technique. It covers track and field events in girls competition such as: sprints, middle-distance and distance running, hurdles and relays
